title: Timing Arctic Stream Crossings
brief: How to time stream crossings when water levels fluctuate dramatically due to glacial melt.
steps: Step 1: Observe the stream for several hours to identify the lowest water level period.
Step 2: Cross during the lowest water level, which varies based on distance from glacier and temperature.
Step 3: Account for water level variance of 2 to 2.5 meters per day when timing your crossing.
Step 4: Plan your campsite location considering this daily water level fluctuation.
warnings: Water levels can change dramatically and unpredictably throughout the day.
Being caught in rising water can trap you on the wrong side or sweep you away.
